caption: This photograph features a signpost surrounded by large boulders. The sign itself is titled "State Land" and marked with the dates 1885 and 1935. It also reads, "Leaving Forest Preserve. Acquired 1885 to 1925. A part of 2,370,000 acres of wild forest maintained for free public use." The background includes a dense tree line, suggesting that this sign marks the boundary of a forested area. The foreground is a gravelly surface with sparsely growing green plants, indicating a well-maintained trail or clearing. The sign is mounted on a single metal pole, and the overall setting appears to be a remote or rural area designated for public access and recreation.
title: New York State highway sign describing the Adirondack Forest Preserve
